body.title: Weather & Best Time to Visit
body.subtitle: Cinque Terre enjoys a classic Mediterranean climate with warm summers, mild winters, and over 300 sunny days per year. Plan your visit for the perfect balance of weather and crowds.

body.title: When Should You Visit?
body.subtitle: Each season offers a different Cinque Terre experience.

features.title: Spring (April-May)
features.description: Best time to visit! Mild temperatures (15-22°C), wildflowers blooming, fewer crowds than summer. Perfect for hiking and photography.

features.title: Summer (June-August)
features.description: Hot and crowded (25-32°C). Best for beaches and swimming. Avoid midday hiking. Book accommodation months ahead.

features.title: Autumn (September-October)
features.description: Excellent! Warm weather (18-25°C), grape harvest, smaller crowds. Wine festivals and golden light. Many consider this ideal.

features.title: Winter (November-March)
features.description: Quiet and mild (8-15°C). Some restaurants close, but villages are authentic. Possible rain. Great for budget travelers.

features.title: Best for Photography
features.description: April-May and September-October. Soft golden light, clear skies, fewer tourists. Early morning and sunset are magical.

features.title: Best for Hiking
features.description: April-May and September-October. Comfortable temperatures, trails in good condition, views are clearest.

body.title: What to Pack
body.subtitle: Be prepared for Mediterranean conditions
body.content: **Summer**: Light, breathable clothing, swimwear, sunscreen, hat. **Spring/Fall**: Layers - mornings can be cool. Light jacket for evenings. **Winter**: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, umbrella. **Always**: Sturdy walking shoes (cobblestones and stairs everywhere), water bottle, and camera!

items.question: What's the best month to visit?
items.answer: May and September are ideal - warm weather, fewer crowds, better availability. April and October are also excellent.

items.question: Is it too crowded in summer?
items.answer: July-August are extremely busy. Trains and trails can be packed. If you must visit then, go early morning or stay overnight to enjoy evenings.

items.question: Does it rain much?
items.answer: Fall and winter have the most rainfall. Flash floods can occur in autumn. Always check forecasts and trail conditions.

items.question: Can I swim in September?
items.answer: Yes! The sea stays warm (22-24°C) through September and into October. Often the best swimming month as tourists thin out.

items.question: What about November?
items.answer: Transition month - can be rainy but often has beautiful clear days. Some services reduce hours. Very peaceful if weather cooperates.

items.question: Is winter worth visiting?
items.answer: Absolutely for atmosphere and budget. Villages are quiet and authentic. Some restaurants close, but enough remain open. Fewer trails open.
